specification.Name: field.convert
specification.Summary: Convert the type of a field.
specification.Description:
Convert takes the field of one type and converts it into another type (e.g. string to integer). 
The applicable types are string, int, float and bool. Converting can be done between any combination of types. Note that
booleans will be converted to numeric values 1 (true) and 0 (false). Processor is only applicable to .Key, .Payload.Before
and .Payload.After prefixes, and only applicable if said fields contain structured data.
If the record contains raw JSON data, then use the processor "decode.json" to parse it into structured data first.
specification.Author: Meroxa, Inc.

field.Description: field is the target field, as it would be addressed in a Go template (e.g. `.Payload.After.foo`). you can only convert fields that are under .Key and .Payload, and said fields should contain structured data.

type.Description: type is the target field type after conversion, available options are: string, int, float, bool.

specification.Name: field.rename
specification.Description:
Rename a group of field names to new names. It is not allowed to rename top-level fields (.Operation, .Position, 
.Key, .Metadata, .Payload.Before, .Payload.After).
Note that this processor only runs on structured data, if the record contains raw JSON data, then use the processor "decode.json" to parse it into structured data first.
specification.Author: Meroxa, Inc.

mapping.Description: mapping is a comma separated list of keys and values for fields and their new names (keys and values are separated by colons ":"). For example: `.Metadata.key:id,.Payload.After.foo:bar`.

examples.description: Rename two fields, one under key, and one under payload.before.
Rename two fields, one under metadata, and one under payload.after.

specification.Name: field.set
specification.Summary: Set the value of a certain field.
specification.Description:
Set the value of a certain field to any value. It is not allowed to set the .Position field.
The new value can be a Go template expression, the processor will evaluate the output and assign the value to the target field.
If the "field" provided doesn't exist, the processor will create that field and assign its value.
This processor can be used for multiple purposes, like extracting fields, hoisting data, inserting fields, copying fields, masking fields, etc.
Note that this processor only runs on structured data, if the record contains raw JSON data, then use the processor
"decode.json" to parse it into structured data first.
specification.Author: Meroxa, Inc.

field.Description: field is the target field, as it would be addressed in a Go template (e.g. `.Payload.After.foo`). Note that it is not allowed to set the .Position field.

value.Description: value is a Go template expression which will be evaluated and stored in `field` (e.g. `{{ .Payload.After }}`).

examples.description: Processor will create a new field and set its value
Processor will set the operation into "update".
set the value under .Payload.After.postgres to true if .Metadata.table="postgres"

specification.Name: field.subset.exclude
specification.Summary: Remove a subset of fields from the record.
specification.Description:
Remove a subset of fields from the record, all the other fields are left untouched. 
If a field is excluded that contains nested data, the whole tree will be removed.  
It is not allowed to exclude .Position or .Operation fields.
Note that this processor only runs on structured data, if the record contains raw JSON data, then use the processor "decode.json" to parse it into structured data first.
specification.Author: Meroxa, Inc.

fields.Description: fields is a comma separated list of target fields, as they would be addressed in a Go template (e.g. `.Metadata,.Payload.After.foo`).

examples.description: exclude metadata, and some fields under payload and key

specification.Name: filter
specification.Summary: Acknowledges all records that get passed to the filter.
specification.Description:
Acknowledges all records that get passed to the filter, so the records will be filtered out if 
the condition provided to the processor is evaluated to "true".
Make sure to add a condition to this processor, otherwise all records will be filtered out."
specification.Author: Meroxa, Inc.
